alert.note: Alert for Halifax (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued September 22 at 4:03AM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH NOW IN EFFECT FROM 3 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON THROUGH SUNDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...A portion of central North Carolina, including the following counties, Edgecombe, Halifax, Nash, Wayne and Wilson. * WHEN...From 3 PM EDT this afternoon through Sunday evening. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Heavy rain associated with Potential Tropical Cyclone Sixteen may result in flooding. Rainfall amounts of 2 to 4 inches are expected with locally higher amounts possible. - http://www.floodsafety.noaa.gov
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
